required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: Pan American Health Organization, Washington, D.C. 20037 USA
United Nations Children's Fund, New York, USA

brief_summary.textblock:
Background: Many of the Caribbean island nations have no data on iodine status in their populations.
Iodine deficiency in children can reduce IQ but can be easily corrected through a program of salt iodization. Study design: The study will be cross-sectional and located at 11 islands of the Caribbean region. At each of the 11 study sites, we will measure the iodine status in school-age children (n = 400 on the two larger islands (Jamaica and Trinidad and Tobago) and n=200 on the other 9 islands) by collecting morning spot urine samples for measurement of urinary iodine concentration (UIC). We will also measure height and weight in all children. We will collect a repeat, next-day spot urine sample in 1/3rd of children to adjust for intra-individual variation in spot UIC and calculate the distribution of population intake. Total UIC sample: (2x400 + 9x200) = 2600 + .33 (2600) = 3500 samples. We will also collect household salt samples from 1/3rd of the children (n=850), about 10 gram of salt, to measure salt iodine concentration.
Study procedures: We will measure population iodine status by UIC in spot urine samples, including a repeat spot urine sample in a subsample of the population. We will also collect household salt samples to assess salt iodine concentrations. This project will be led by the ETH Zürich, and conducted as a collaboration between the ETH Zürich, UNICEF and the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO). The fieldwork will be carried out over approximately 6 months, from January to July 2018. Deliverables: 1) Iodine status of 11 islands in the Caribbean, 9 of them island nations, two of them (Guadeloupe and Martinique) French protectorates. 2) Based on these data, evidence-based recommendations on iodine strategies for the region.

primary_outcome.measure: Iodine status (UIC in spot urine samples)
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of iodine status based on median urinary iodine concentration in spot urine samples

secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of iodine concentration in salt samples brought in by participants
